news.title: UK online safety law leads to 5m extra age checks a day for pornography sites
news.summary: Five million extra online age checks a day are being carried out in the UK since the introduction of age-gating for pornography sites. Age Verification Providers Association said there had been a sharp increase in additional age checks.

news.title: YouTube most popular first TV destination for children, Ofcom finds
news.summary: One in five young viewers go to platform first when they turn on TV. Older people also watch more of its content, according to Ofcom survey.

news.title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 7 review: great-looking and fun, but iterative Android
news.summary: Flagship flip folder fits even bigger screen in pocketable clamshell, with a larger cover display, slightly slimmer design and faster chip. Samsung’s seventh-generation Flip phone gains a bigger cover screen on the outside and a larger folding display on the inside.

news.title: Don’t feel guilty about letting your kids game during the summer break – celebrate it
news.summary: After a long day of exploring, swimming or hanging with grandparents, games from Fortnite to Super Mario are a good way to wind down. There is so much pressure and guilt around children and gaming, especially during long school breaks. I think we need to seriously redress our outlook as a society.

news.title: Militsioner – finally a game that asks, is it illegal to use an apple to bribe a giant policeman?
news.summary: Planning is half the fun in immersive sims. In Militsioner, you have been arrested for some manner of nebulous crime and must now leave town as quickly as you can. Sadly, there’s that policeman to deal with first, a melancholic but watchful giant.
